thread.title_full: Airboats carrying tourists crash in Everglades, injuring at... | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Jim Hayward
title: Airboats carrying tourists crash in Everglades, injuring at...
text:
Two airboats full of tourists crashed in stormy weather in Everglades National Park today, according to a report by The Miami Herald .
There were 24 passengers, and 16 or 17 were taken to area hospitals with minor injuries, a Miami-Dade Fire Rescue official told The Herald .
An airboat ride in the Everglades. (Contributed file photo) The boats collided around 11:30 a.m. at Gator Park, about 7 miles west of Krome Avenue. Just after the crash, the National Weather Service issued a flood advisory for several areas in Miami-Dade. The county received up to 4 inches of rain in some areas.
Some passengers fell into the water and had to be helped to shore, an employee at Florida Airboat Rides told The Herald. There were no major injuries, the employee said, adding that airboat rides continued when the weather cleared.
The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission is investigating the crash, the story said.
See the full story from The Miami Herald
